intro: Pterogastra major, commonly known as the giant pterogastra, is a species of flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
